a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 3 * x + 2 - 5 * x + 18"
shows  "P x = -2 * x + 20"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify the following expression in $x$:

$$3x + 2 - 5x + 18$$ The final Answer is -2x + 20
 ### Proof
 Rearranging and grouping, we obtain $(3x - 5x) + (2 + 18) = \boxed{-2x + 20}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 3 * x + 2 - 5 * x + 18"
shows  "P x = -2 * x + 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Simplify the function $P(x) = 3x + 2 - 5x + 18$. The final simplified form of the function is $P(x) = -2x + 20$.
